Title.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate whether PLX-PAD would increase amputation-free survival in people with CLTI who were not candidates for revascularization.

Trial_Design.evidence: randomized, parallel-group, placebo-controlled, multinational, blinded, trial

Participants.evidence: People with CLTI and minor tissue loss (Rutherford 5) who were unsuitable for revascularization

Intervention.evidence: PLX-PAD was compared with placebo (2 : 1 randomization), with 30 intramuscular injections (0.5 ml each) into the index leg on days 0 and 60.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate whether PLX-PAD would increase amputation-free survival in people with CLTI who were not candidates for revascularization.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Planned follow-up was 12–36 months, and included vital status, amputations, lesion size, pain and quality-of-life assessments, haemodynamic parameters, and adverse events.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomized, parallel-group, placebo-controlled, multinational, blinded, trial

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 213 patients enrolled, 143 were randomized to PLX-PAD and 70 to placebo.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 213 patients enrolled, 143 were randomized to PLX-PAD and 70 to placebo.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The probability of major amputation or death was similar for placebo and PLX-PAD (33 and 28.6% respectively; HR 0.93, 95% c.i. 0.53 to 1.63; P = 0.788).

Harms.evidence: Most patients (76.6%) reported at least one adverse event, which were mostly expected events in CLTI, such as skin ulcer or gangrene.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: NCT03006770 ( http://www.clinicaltrials.gov ); 2015-005532-18 (EudraCT Clinical Trials register - Search for 2015-005532-18).
